Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the World Health Organization declared COVID-19 a pandemic in March.
Understate: The claim understates the impact and classification of COVID-19 as a pandemic.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no evidence that the CDC removed the term "pandemic" and replaced it with "outbreak" on its website homepage.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes a problematic assumption that the change in terminology on the CDC website means COVID-19 was never a pandemic.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation that the use of the term "outbreak" on the CDC website does not negate the classification of COVID-19 as a pandemic.
